assignmentBanner.title: A Message to Evaluators
assignmentBanner.message: This is a lemon.io take-home assignment for a Full Stack Developer role at a healthcare startup that uses MRI to detect early-stage cancers across multiple organs.
assignmentBanner.process: When I read "add any features you would add for a real production MVP," my mind immediately went to what production actually means in regulated healthcare: compliance awareness, offline reliability for hospital networks, Azure deployment to match your stack, and product analytics to validate hypotheses. Every feature in this app traces back to that reasoning.
assignmentBanner.branding: Even the branding is intentional — I named the project after lemon.io and built a visual identity around it to show I can adapt frontend design to any brand guidelines.
assignmentBanner.personal: I had a genuine blast building this. The idea of working on technology that helps detect cancer early — and potentially saves lives — is the kind of work I want to do. I hope the code, the architecture, and the decisions behind them speak for themselves.

problemSolving.title: 3 Redesigns, Not 3 Patches
problemSolving.subtitle: When architectural problems surfaced, they were fixed at the root — not worked around. Each redesign touched dozens of files across all layers.

items.title: Column-Status Invariant
items.problem: Tasks had two independent sources of truth for lifecycle state — a Status enum and a Column position. They desynchronized after multiple moves, leaving tasks in undefined states.
items.solution: Made Column the single source of truth. Each Column stores a TargetStatus; when a task moves to a column, its status is atomically set. Removed redundant Complete/Uncomplete methods.
items.outcome: Eliminated an entire class of synchronization bugs. Every task's status is now deterministic and derived from board position.

items.title: Bounded Context Split
items.problem: Task and Board were tightly coupled in a single bounded context. Task stored ColumnId and Position (board spatial concerns), and every status change required loading the Board aggregate.
items.solution: Split into Task (upstream, owns lifecycle) and Board (downstream conformist, owns spatial placement via TaskCard value object). Application handlers coordinate cross-context operations.
items.outcome: 98 files changed across all layers. Each context now has clear aggregate boundaries and can evolve independently.

items.title: Card Ordering Redesign
items.problem: Dense integer positions caused position drift — dragging cards created collisions (two cards at position 1). Delete and archive left orphaned card entries on the board.
items.solution: Replaced with sparse decimal ranks (midpoint insertion). Changed API from index-based to neighbor-based (previousTaskId/nextTaskId) — intent-based contract that survives backend strategy changes.
items.outcome: O(1) moves with zero position collisions. The API contract is strategy-agnostic — switching from decimal ranks to LexoRank would only change backend computation.

testing.title: Testing as a Design Constraint
testing.subtitle: Diverse testing strategies that catch different classes of bugs. Property-based testing on both stacks, dual-database CI, visual regression, and compile-time API contract guards.

items.title: Property-Based Testing
items.description: FsCheck on .NET, fast-check on TypeScript. Value objects validated with randomized inputs — any string within bounds creates a valid title, any empty string fails. Tests the invariants, not just examples.

items.title: Dual-Database CI
items.description: Every push runs the full backend suite against both SQLite and SQL Server in parallel. Catches provider-specific SQL differences before they reach production.

items.title: Visual Regression
items.description: 26 Playwright screenshot baselines across light/dark themes, desktop/mobile viewports, and key pages. Pixel-level comparison catches unintended UI changes.

items.title: WCAG Contrast Testing
items.description: Automated contrast ratio checks against WCAG 2.1 AA thresholds. Every color pairing in the design system verified programmatically across both themes.

items.title: E2E Data Isolation
items.description: Each E2E describe block creates a unique user with a timestamp-based email. No shared state, no cleanup between tests. True isolation without test-order dependencies.

items.title: OpenAPI Enum Guards
items.description: TypeScript enums are derived from the OpenAPI spec at build time. When the backend adds an enum value, the frontend fails to compile until the const is updated — and translation coverage tests verify all languages.

highlights.title: Engineering Highlights
highlights.subtitle: Implementation choices that improve reliability and maintainability, especially where traceability and predictable behavior matter.

items.title: Deterministic Status Transitions
items.description: Column determines status — a task's status is always derived from its board position, eliminating synchronization bugs between UI state and domain state.
items.why: In healthcare workflows, predictable state machines prevent tasks from entering undefined states.

items.title: Sparse Decimal Ranking
items.description: Card positions use sparse decimal ranks (e.g., 1.0, 2.0), so reordering is O(1) — insert between two neighbors without recalculating all positions.
items.why: Eliminates position drift in concurrent environments and scales to thousands of cards without performance degradation.

items.title: Immutable Audit Trail
items.description: Every security-relevant action is recorded as an append-only audit entry with actor, timestamp, resource, and request context.
items.why: Non-negotiable for compliance — provides a tamper-evident log for regulatory inquiries and incident response.

items.title: AES-256-GCM Field Encryption
items.description: Sensitive notes are encrypted at the field level using AES-256-GCM before storage. Decryption requires the user's password and is audit-logged.
items.why: Protects data at rest even if the database is compromised. Access is always authenticated and traceable.

items.title: Result Pattern Over Exceptions
items.description: Business operations return Result<T> instead of throwing exceptions. Errors are values — typed, composable, and impossible to accidentally ignore.
items.why: Makes failure paths explicit in the type system, reducing surprise runtime errors in critical workflows.

items.title: Offline Mutation Queue
items.description: When offline, mutations are queued in IndexedDB and replayed in order when connectivity resumes. Reads use cached data from service worker.
items.why: Field workers in healthcare settings often have unreliable connectivity. Offline-first ensures no work is lost.
